author: vivek
title: Analytics Data Hub
description: Data relating to the Cardano ecosystem is granular and scattered, making it difficult to access and use for analytics or machine learning.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well written and it certainly addresses a key gap-in-the-market for development projects on Cardano. These datasets could have innumerable use-cases within future development projects and would certainly benefit developers in need of such data. As a tech founder in this space I also know the hassle of managing servers, spooling up nodes and running queries against DBSync. I agree that this proposal addresses the challenge setting!
f6_assessments.q1: The team has an established presence in two prior funds as well as a wealth of appropriate experience. The team’s involvement with the Cardano ecosystem also greatly validates their incentive to deliver as participants in the broader ecosystem. The team appears to posses ample competence to deliver!
f6_assessments.q2: The team has a defined project plan and has already identified the KPIs for success, however it is not clear what the community’s ability is in the auditability of the project? Will the auditing metrics be published publicly, if so , where can they be found? I think the team has a well established internal cadence of auditability, but the community aspect to that auditability needs to be detailed a bit clearer.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal can add additional data to empower different cardano dev teams utilizing the data analytics, and team is given the funds in previous two rounds, can close accelerate to create a data subscription model to be self-sustaining in future.
f6_assessments.q1: Plan to execute - Team is closeing on the previous analytics work successfully and this increment in data analytics will defintely help to finalize to subscription model  Team experience - very strong, Cost - 3months is critical, roll-out support for 6months should it be planned in future fund rounds ?
f6_assessments.q2:
Given the team has been successful in the previous funds and there is ongoing work, there is high likelihood of taking to net level of data subscription model. Given the current two fund stages are successful, team can also pursue specific needs from major project communities to gain ground as well as are existing major players willing to pay for the data shared.
Team has the KPI for datasets in depth and breadth and would have been more relevant if they had used examples from the currently ongoing funded projects and how they are expanding. Team's SDG KPI metrics on gender/sector enrolment is not a perfect KPI for analytics work.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is very exciting and addresses some key directions provided in the challenge : 
- Dashboards
- API's, and oracles.
- Incentivization structures and probably more. 

If successful, it could evolve in a solid data marketplace and serve the Cardano community with data and insights for further DApp development purposes
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is solid and probably adequate for an MVP. However, since this is a new legal entity, the timelines appear to too optimistic to get started , recruit staff and deliver an MVP within 3 months.

It would potentially be more cautious to carry out a more indepth "discovery phase" within 3 months and build a business case that will help further plan the product roadmap, key milestones and capacity plan with a more ambitious budget estimate.

This indeed has the potential to grow into a full fledged data marketplace
f6_assessments.q2: The milestone plan is well thought out in terms of phases, but would benefit from being more detailed and have a budget breakdown by phase as mentioned in the proposal . Some estimates would help in order to compare if the budget by phase were enough or higher estimates are needed. A capacity plan for allocating the resources by phase would also help to measure if the committed effort by sprint was used and delivered on the sprint objectives

f6_assessments.q0: The purpose of this proposal is to fix the lack of or the ineffectiveness of the data organizing on Cardano data system, make it easier for users to access and use for analytics or machine learning. The problem here is a necessary tool for gathering and sorting those data. Firstly, I strongly agree that this proposal aligns with the challenge. Secondly, despite it’s not really organized, still it’s very well articulated and give the community an overall look of the porducts. The team has describe the solution with many details as well as how it’s going to help developing the ecosystem. The idea of building the initial MVP of a community data hub which will provide consolidated analytics-ready data to the Cardano ecosystem totally aligns the addressed problem. I can see that they have been working on some related projects for a while and that speaks volume about how committed and capable the proposer is. Not only this project can be a data solution for the ecosystem, but also it may contribute with the funding. The only thing that makes this proposal not getting the perfect rate is the presentation. It’s a bit all over the place with some duplicated points, so I hope that the team could be a better editing next time
f6_assessments.q1: The team has shown that they have had enough talents with relevant experience to bring this project to live. With a diagram of the plan progress, it’s very easy to follow up every step even the timing is overlapping. The plan follows closely with the solution idea and timeline of every step is well presented with a clear target/deliverables. It’s very helpful to keep track with the progression and make adjustment in case you need to. The proposal has also a fair and sensible budget breakdown for short term and further plan.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some great milestones and key metrics which can measure quantitatively. However the KPIs should come with time-related target for the auditor to have a fair justification of the project in the future. The look of the successful project should come with KPIs in numbers, for instance with volumes, how do you expect the size of data sets created should be or with the relevance, what is the successful number after every certain stage. It will certainly help this proposal get the full rating.

f6_assessments.q0: Data analytics are important variables for data analysis and interpretation and/or machine learning inputs. Having access to this resources is often time consuming and costly to developers. Being a proposal that is a follow up to other similar projects in previous funds, go to show the significance of having this curated free data for easy developments of projects in the ecosystem. The proposal is well within the objectives and goals of the challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has provided detailed information about the team's experience, skill and competence to deliver this project effectively and, considering the fact, similar projects by the team had been funded in previous funding rounds. The proposal has an explicit scheme of implementing the project. In addition, the budget analysis and the Milestones presented is reasonable and detailed. Risk factors were considered accordingly which gives credence that the team is capable of effectively implementing the project within its stipulated time frame.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided information that seems  to be basis and/or measures to monitor its progress however this measures are void of quantifiable metrics to evidently assess the project. However, the project's milestone also can be used by the community to assess the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
Analytics data Hub is a data exchange that allows you to efficiently and securely exchange data assets across organizations to address challenges of data. As proposer says data which includes all cardano  ecosystem is granular and scattered and  disbanded, Which will make it very difficult to access and use for analytics or machine learning, Creating one data hub for the Cardano ecosystem that makes historical and modelled datasets, Which brings multiple access mechanisms to users, 
This will allow  combines the critical data collection and analytical features of these well-known solutions,
The proposer idea Data relating to the Cardano ecosystem is granular and scattered, making it difficult to access and use for analytics or machine learning ,
  This proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer having experience in publishing and being founder  himself of Cardano Canucks, and Canuckz Publishing with 30+ yrs experience in data infrastructure, analysis and data visualization for enterprises,
additional source data  which must be integrated in order to make the data optimally useful,
Stake pool metadata server (SMASH)
Extended metadata files as-per the adapools.org standard
Token data from sources such as the Cardano Foundation token registry, and the NFT marketplaces , The initial MVP Data Hub will allow the download of scheduled CSV data sets. In the future, the range of sharing methods will be expanded and it  enables data sharing by connecting producers of data with consumers of data.
With all the data provided and experience and time plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget plan laid down by proposer is acceptable and reasonable, 
as requested funds which will be used for first 3 months of development, and 6 months of infrastructure costs, 
Architect, Graphic designers,  web over, data engineer, project manager pays,

The team consisting Michael Stewart, Vivek Nankissoor have both experience more than 15+ years database requirements, design and development,
having many development fields experience and  reasonable budget laydown, 
They have provided how development is measured on time, 
secondary KPIs may include, 
proposer tells once project will serve as the foundation for the enablement of data for analytics: modeling, visualization, machine learning, applications specific to particular domains,
With all the   information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

solution: A data hub for the Cardano ecosystem that makes historical and modelled datasets available through multiple access mechanisms.
experience: Founders of Cardano Canucks, and Canuckz Publishing with 30+ yrs experience in data infrastructure, analysis and data visualization for enterprises.
